+#define DISPATCH_ALL_FLOATING_TYPES(TYPE, NAME, F...)                             \
+  [&]() {                                                                         \
+    const Type& the_type = TYPE;                                                  \
+    switch (the_type.scalarType()) {                                              \
+      case ScalarType::Double: {                                                  \
+        using scalar_t = double;                                                  \
+        return F();                                                               \
+      } case ScalarType::Float: {                                                 \
+        using scalar_t = float;                                                   \
+        return F();                                                               \
+      } case ScalarType::Half: {                                                  \
+        using scalar_t = half;                                                    \
body: in the template version we use "Half" instead of "half"; does that work here?  I don't know what will happen now if you try to use this dispatch macro on a CPU tensor.  If you use "Half" you'd maybe need to change the templated type in AccumulateType as well.
